data.text: @marg_fitzlaw2 @circlete @ItaOKelly @Hurleronditch11 @peterfitz17  But Ita, didn't @campaignforleo nearly bring down the government in defense of a female Taináiste?
@ItaOKelly Its amazing Joan Burton highlighted it, Joan cut lone parents and leo did not realise he had inherited these cuts....
@ItaOKelly @EamonMelia Some excellent comments but as you say women make up 50% of the electorate yet so few women get elected.
@circlete @ItaOKelly The three women did nothing wrong are you for real.Just like Flannnrry and Callinan they did little right and deserved to go.
@circlete @ItaOKelly If they did nothing wrong they would be still in their positions feminist or not they were not truthful or honest
@ItaOKelly OMG disgraceful from Him thank you for opening my eyes to Wat actually goes on

@ItaOKelly I have a real problem with so called feminist journalists who did not stand up for Frances Fitzgerald, Noreen O’Sullivan, Angela Kerins who were hounded out of office not because they did anything wrong but because they were women.
@Patmclaughlin18 Thanks Pat.
@ItaOKelly Bravo Ita, very well said.
@ItaOKelly @williamhboney1 Excellent. I fear it’s not just Leo who has a problem with women,our history of our treatment of women and children is shameful
@pmbairrins @ItaOKelly Remember the FF coalitions “Three Marys”!!!
@ItaOKelly I get that and agree that women should make up approximately of all professions, however not at the expense of not selecting the best person for the job.

@francisfoley Misses the point.
It is across Govt. not just electrd representatives.

@ItaOKelly Ita the #women members of the oireachtas is small therefore he cannot be expected to discriminate by selecting women to become ministers just to satisfy a gender quota. If #women=men then you have a valid point. More women need to stand and get elected.
@socratic_gadfly @ItaOKelly It’s a ridiculous comment.
@cags_soc Thanks
@ItaOKelly Well said
@ItaOKelly Joan Burton was not good for women.
@socratic_gadfly @ItaOKelly Ridiculous comment!
@socratic_gadfly @ItaOKelly @_IHREC Really ? My experience isnt unique so ??

@socratic_gadfly @ItaOKelly One of the worst state organisations to try to deal with is actually the @_IHREC - 2 officials refused to actually take or return telephone calls Y& these were pplI had actually had spoken with previously
@socratic_gadfly @ItaOKelly I spent, or wasted, a lot of my time writing to Irelands gay politicians - complete waste of time -they dont care about equality
@socratic_gadfly @ItaOKelly Since when have people in minority groups been incapable of being ' anti' or of discrimination ? Eg many Bisexuals claim LGBT discriminate against them
@ItaOKelly @JoeKChristian I’ve had that feeling about him right from the start. He exudes misogyny.

@ItaOKelly The gender of a representative is not an issue, that everyone can contribute to society is all that matters, ie that there are no barriers to participate.  Those who lead cdnt do it without support in other equally important aspects of life, again, regardless of gender.
@ItaOKelly bu I thought that Champagne for Leo was our youngest progressive liberal cool ...
@ItaOKelly Absolute PC nonsense.
@ItaOKelly Nah. He doesn't have a problem with women. He has a problem with the working class. He has a problem with anyone who has a soul.
@ItaOKelly 👏👏👏👏👏💕
@rmcg2799 Thanks Rachel.
@edelkirley 😄

@ItaOKelly Couldn’t agree more. Smug, self-satisfied, PR-driven, lacking any empathy or compassion for those who don’t fit his male, able-bodied model of “good citizen-worker” and thinks he’s ticked all the “diversity” boxes just by existing. #notmytaoiseach

@CarolineMcGee My pleasure!
Thanks for reading and sharing.
